items.title: Beyond iPhones: Apple steps up India hiring as it looks to manufacture Airpods, iPads
items.description: The iPhone maker has advertised for several supply chain positions as well as openings for global roles in India. It is expected to begin making Airpods in April

items.title: How to deal with Indian IT stocks after Accenture’s cautious commentary?
items.description: Though the company’s business performance was steady in Q2FY25, it called out specific areas of uncertainty

items.title: Agri Picks Report March 21, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The sowing of summer crops in Maharashtra has reached 359,482 hectares as of Monday, up 29% on year from 278,687 hectares sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Weekly Tactical Pick: Will this jeweller regain its shine?
items.description: Senco Gold is continuing a healthy network expansion and plans to open about 20 stores in the next fiscal. Geographical expansion and entry into new markets are expected to drive growth.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp to invest Rs 525 crore in Euler Motors, forays into e-three wheeler space
items.description: Euler Motors has a presence in 30 cities in India and is engaged in the designing, manufacturing and sale & service of electric three-wheelers.

items.title: Bharat Biotech launches $75 million cell & gene therapy facility in Hyderabad
items.description: “Bharat Biotech aims to democratize gene therapies, traditionally considered prohibitively expensive and available primarily in developed nations or premium institutions," Dr. Raches Ella, Chief Development Officer, Bharat Biotech, spearheading this CGT initiative, said.

items.title: SoftBank seals $6.5 billion deal for chip designer Ampere
items.description: Ampere is one of a group of companies that tried to use Arm technology, which dominates in mobile phones, to create a niche in the lucrative data center chip business

items.title: India's upcoming green hydrogen hubs will be hungry for power, prompting calls to explore 24x7 green electricity
items.description: The proposed green hydrogen hub in Mundra will require 22 GW renewable energy, followed by the proposed hub at Kandla port. In total, Gujarat alone would require 32.3 GW of renewable electricity for its green hydrogen hubs, according to the National Electricity Plan.

items.title: National Electricity Plan pegs transmission capex at Rs 4.9 lakh crore for 2027-2032
items.description: India’s battery energy storage capacity is expected to be about 47 GW, against the current capacity of about 300 MW, the report said.

items.title: Breakfast meeting revives Hinduja group's delayed bus factory in Andhra Pradesh
items.description: The facility with an annual production capacity of 4,800 buses, features Nalanda, a modern Learning Center, and an advanced Service Training Center
